mads.note: Brill's new Pauly: "Palladius, Latin grammarian, probably of African origin and Christian beliefs, active in the 4th cent. AD. His work, perhaps in two books (he follows the presentation of the types of words with a section De ratione metrorum vel structurarum ), has not been transmitted as a whole, but rather parts of it have been transmitted under the name of Ps.-Probus (Instituta Artium, [1]) and as excerpta in dialogue form under the name of Audax..."
